node.statement: Step 1.3.2 (Melonic dominance breakdown): In the classical BLM model (q=1), the tetrahedron diagram scales as sqrt(j) while the melonic vacuum scales as j, giving 1/sqrt(j) suppression. For fixed q ≠ 1, the tetrahedron diagram involves {6j}_q ~ exp(j * Vol_hyp) while the melonic self-energy involves [2j+1]_q ~ q^{2j}/(q-q^{-1}). Both grow exponentially, and their ratio is generically NOT suppressed — it is itself exponential: exp(j * (Vol_hyp - 2 log q)). When Vol_hyp > 2 log q, non-melonic diagrams DOMINATE melonic ones.
